notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

body.p: The following Scandinavian classics, are published and sold by John Anderson Publishing Company [in English].
Comedies, by Holberg. Contents: Jeppe on the Hill, and Erasmus Montanus.
Poems, by Tesner. Contents: The Children of the Lord's Supper, and Frithjof's Sage.
Poems and Songs, by Bjornsterne Bjornson.
The Prose Edda, translated from the Icelandic.
Modern Icelandic Plays, by Johann Sigurjonsson, Contents: Eyvind, of the Hills, and The Hraun Farm.
Marie Grubbe, by J. P. Jacobsen [Danish]. Translated by Hanna Astruplarsen [Dane].
Gosta Berling's Saga, by Selma Lagerlof.
Nils Lynne, by J. P. Jacobsen [Dane].
The Voyages of the Norsemen to America, by W. Hovgaard.
Ballad Criticism in Scandiavia and Great Britain During the Eighteenth Century, by Sigurd Bernhard Hustuedt.
